_meta.description: Printer intelligence database: firmware quirks, material compatibility, calibration guidance, and known failure modes. Keyed by the same printer_id as safety_profiles.json.

PETG.notes: Reduce fan to avoid layer delamination.

TPU.notes: Print slowly (20-30mm/s). Disable retraction if bowden.

calibration.first_steps: Level bed, set Z-offset, run temperature tower for each filament brand.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print single-wall cube, measure wall thickness. Adjust flow multiplier = expected/measured.
calibration.retraction_test: Print retraction tower varying 0.5-6mm. Find shortest distance without stringing.

ender3.display_name: Creality Ender 3 / Ender 3 Pro / Ender 3 V2

PLA.notes: Sweet spot for stock PTFE hotend.

PETG.notes: Keep below 240C to protect PTFE tube.

TPU.notes: Very difficult with bowden setup — print at 15-20mm/s, disable retraction.

quirks: PTFE tube degrades above 240°C — produces toxic fumes. Upgrade to all-metal hotend for higher temps.
Bowden tube couplers loosen over time — check and replace couplers every 6 months.
Stock bed springs are weak — upgrade to yellow springs or silicone spacers for stable leveling.
V2 uses a 32-bit board (4.2.2/4.2.7) — flash Marlin firmware for thermal runaway protection if not updated.
Extruder arm is plastic and cracks — inspect regularly, replace with aluminum extruder kit.

calibration.first_steps: Manual mesh bed leveling with paper method. Set Z-offset. Print bed level test pattern.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print single-wall cube at 200C. Target: 0.4mm wall = 0.4mm measured.
calibration.retraction_test: Bowden needs 4-6mm retraction at 45mm/s. Start at 5mm and tune down.
calibration.esteps: Stock e-steps often off by 5-10%. Measure 100mm extrusion, calibrate via M92 E<value> + M500.

failure_modes.cause: PTFE tube degradation or extruder arm crack
failure_modes.fix: Replace PTFE tube, inspect extruder arm for cracks

failure_modes.cause: Belt tension too loose or eccentric nuts too tight
failure_modes.fix: Tighten Y belt — should twang like guitar string. Adjust eccentric nuts until bed slides freely with no wobble

failure_modes.cause: Bed not level or Z-offset too high
failure_modes.fix: Re-level with paper method, lower Z-offset by 0.05mm increments

failure_modes.cause: Retraction too short for bowden setup
failure_modes.fix: Increase retraction to 5-6mm at 45mm/s

PETG.notes: All-metal hotend safe at these temps.

ABS.notes: Print in enclosure or draft-free room.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU well — 30mm/s, 0.5mm retraction.

quirks: CR-Touch probe occasionally gives false readings — clean probe tip regularly.
Sprite extruder gear tension spring can be too tight for TPU — loosen one turn.
S1 Pro has a higher temp hotend (300C) than S1 (260C) — check your model before printing high-temp materials.

calibration.first_steps: Run CR-Touch auto-level. Fine-tune Z-offset with live babystep during first layer.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print single-wall cube at 205C. Direct drive usually needs 95-98% flow.
calibration.retraction_test: Start at 0.8mm retraction, 40mm/s. Sprite extruder rarely needs more than 1mm.

failure_modes.cause: Sprite extruder gear tension too loose or filament grinding
failure_modes.fix: Adjust gear tension screw. Clean extruder gears with brass brush.

failure_modes.cause: Heat creep in all-metal hotend
failure_modes.fix: Ensure heatsink fan runs at 100%. Print PETG at 230-235C, not higher.

PLA.notes: Higher temp than usual due to speed. Open door for PLA to avoid heat creep.

PETG.notes: Keep door closed. Reduce speed to 150mm/s for quality.

ABS.notes: Enclosed chamber ideal for ABS. Full speed OK.

quirks: Input shaping must be tuned per-machine — run ADXL345 calibration after any hardware changes.
Stock Klipper firmware is customized — community firmware (Guilouz) unlocks more features.
Print PLA with door open — enclosed chamber causes heat creep and jams at high speeds.
LIDAR on K1 Max sometimes miscalibrates — verify Z offset manually if first layer issues.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in self-test. Input shaping auto-tune. Verify Z offset with first layer print.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print flow tower at target speed. K1 volumetric flow varies significantly with speed.
calibration.retraction_test: 0.5mm retraction at 40mm/s is usually optimal. Don't exceed 1mm.

failure_modes.symptom: Filament jams during fast PLA printing
failure_modes.cause: Heat creep in enclosed chamber
failure_modes.fix: Open enclosure door for PLA. Ensure hotend fan is at 100%.

failure_modes.cause: Input shaping not tuned or belt tension off
failure_modes.fix: Re-run input shaper calibration. Check belt tension on both X and Y.

PLA.notes: Prusa's own PLA profiles are excellent.

PETG.notes: Prusament PETG at 240C/90C bed works perfectly.

ABS.notes: Enclosure strongly recommended. Prusa sells one.

ASA.notes: Similar to ABS. Better UV resistance for outdoor parts.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU well at 25-35mm/s.

quirks: PINDA probe is temperature-sensitive — first layer calibration varies with ambient temp. MK3S+ SuperPINDA is better.
Bondtech gears need cleaning every ~500h of printing — use brass brush.
Filament sensor (IR) can false-trigger with translucent filaments — can be disabled in firmware menu.
Stock textured PEI sheet works great for PETG but PLA sometimes sticks too well — use smooth sheet for PLA.

calibration.first_steps: Run first layer calibration (from LCD menu). This is the single most important calibration step.
calibration.flow_rate_test: PrusaSlicer bundles excellent calibration models — use built-in flow tower.
calibration.retraction_test: 0.8mm at 35mm/s is the factory default and rarely needs adjustment.

failure_modes.symptom: First layer height varies across bed
failure_modes.cause: PINDA probe thermal drift
failure_modes.fix: Upgrade to SuperPINDA. Or let printer warm up 10 min before printing.

failure_modes.cause: Partially clogged nozzle or cold pull needed
failure_modes.fix: Do cold pull with nylon at 285C → pull at 90C. Replace nozzle if persists.

PLA.notes: PrusaSlicer has native MK4 profiles. Use them.

PETG.notes: Nextruder handles PETG well at these temps.

ABS.notes: Enclosure recommended. MK4S improved part cooling.

quirks: Nextruder has extremely short retraction (0.4mm) — don't increase it, you'll cause jams.
Load cell bed probe is very accurate but sensitive to nozzle cleanliness — wipe nozzle before probing.
Input shaping enabled by default — don't add resonance compensation in slicer, it's firmware-level.
MK4S adds high-flow Nextruder — higher volumetric flow limits than MK4.

calibration.first_steps: Run first layer calibration from LCD. Then print calibration cube and measure dimensions.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Stock profiles are well-calibrated — adjust only if measuring wall width deviation > 0.02mm.
calibration.retraction_test: Do NOT change retraction from 0.4mm unless you have specific stringing issues. Nextruder is designed for this value.

failure_modes.cause: Load cell too sensitive or nozzle dirty
failure_modes.fix: Clean nozzle with brass brush before prints. Recalibrate load cell via Service menu.

failure_modes.cause: Retraction set too high (above 1mm)
failure_modes.fix: Reset retraction to 0.4mm in slicer profile. Nextruder requires very short retraction.

PLA.notes: Excellent PLA printer out of the box.

PETG.notes: Keep below 240C for PTFE safety. Works well otherwise.

quirks: PTFE-lined hotend — same 240C limit as Ender 3. Upgrade to all-metal for higher temps.
SuperPINDA probe included on Mini+ — much better than original Mini's MINDA.
Small build volume (180x180x180) — plan part orientation carefully.
Bowden tube needs replacement every ~500h or if retraction quality drops.

calibration.first_steps: Run first layer calibration from LCD. Mini's auto-level is reliable.
calibration.retraction_test: Bowden needs 3.2mm retraction at 70mm/s — these are good defaults.

failure_modes.symptom: Stringing after many hours of use
failure_modes.cause: Bowden tube gap at hotend develops
failure_modes.fix: Re-seat bowden tube. Cut clean end. Push flush against nozzle.

PLA.notes: Open door for PLA on long prints to prevent heat creep.

PETG.notes: Enclosed chamber helps with PETG bed adhesion.

ABS.notes: Excellent enclosed ABS printing. Chamber pre-heat recommended.

ASA.notes: Same as ABS profile. Great outdoor part material.

TPU.notes: Reduce speed to 60-80mm/s for TPU. Direct drive handles it well.

PA-CF.notes: Carbon fiber nylon — requires hardened nozzle (included). Chamber heated.

PC.notes: Polycarbonate needs full enclosure and dry filament.

quirks: LiDAR first-layer detection can reject prints with textured top surfaces — disable 'first layer inspection' for affected models.
AMS (auto material system) has trouble with flexible filaments — feed TPU manually through the direct path.
Hardened steel nozzle included — lower thermal conductivity means slightly higher temps needed vs brass.
Firmware updates can change behavior — check Bambu wiki after updates.
MQTT protocol for control — Kiln's Bambu adapter handles this natively.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in calibration sequence (vibration, flow, first layer). It's very thorough.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Bambu's auto-flow calibration is excellent. Only manual-tune if switching to non-Bambu filament.
calibration.retraction_test: 0.5mm at 30mm/s is factory-optimal. Don't change unless experiencing specific issues.

failure_modes.cause: AMS buffer tangled or spool resistance too high
failure_modes.fix: Check AMS buffer tube for kinks. Ensure spool rotates freely. Use AMS-friendly spool holders.

failure_modes.symptom: First layer adhesion failure with engineering materials
failure_modes.cause: Build plate not clean or chamber not pre-heated
failure_modes.fix: Clean with IPA. Pre-heat chamber by running bed at 100C for 10 min before print.

PLA.notes: Same as X1C. Open door for PLA.

ABS.notes: Enclosed chamber for ABS. Pre-heat recommended.

quirks: No LiDAR — can't do first layer inspection. Manually verify first layer quality.
Same mechanical platform as X1C — reliability and print quality are identical.
AMS compatible — same considerations as X1C for flexible filaments.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in calibration. No LiDAR auto-detection, so manual first layer check is important.

PLA.notes: Great PLA printer out of the box.

PETG.notes: Open frame — draft-free room recommended for PETG.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU. Reduce speed to 50mm/s.

quirks: Open frame — no ABS printing without aftermarket enclosure.
AMS Lite compatible (4-slot) — different from X1C full AMS.
Bed-slinger design — heavier parts may shift at very high accelerations.
Slightly lower max speeds than X1C/P1S due to bed-slinger kinematics.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in calibration from touchscreen. Simple and effective.

failure_modes.cause: Bed-slinger Y acceleration too high for heavy parts
failure_modes.fix: Reduce Y acceleration in slicer for prints taller than 100mm or with heavy infill.

PLA.notes: Open panels or remove top hat for PLA to prevent heat creep.

ABS.notes: This is what Vorons are built for. Chamber target 50-60C.

ASA.notes: Same as ABS approach. Excellent results.

PA-CF.notes: Requires hardened nozzle. Chamber heated. Dry filament critical.

quirks: Kit printer — quality depends heavily on build quality. Follow the manual precisely.
Input shaping MUST be tuned with accelerometer (ADXL345) — pre-built configurations don't transfer between machines.
Z offset varies with chamber temperature — set it after chamber has reached target temp.
Afterburner/Stealthburner toolhead choice significantly affects max flow rate and cooling performance.

calibration.first_steps: Input shaping calibration with ADXL345. Pressure advance tuning. Z offset with warm chamber.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Critical for Vorons — volumetric flow varies hugely by hotend choice (Dragon vs Rapido vs Mosquito).
calibration.retraction_test: Direct drive: 0.3-0.6mm retraction. Heavily depends on hotend — tune empirically.

failure_modes.cause: Gantry not square, belt tension uneven, or Z motors not synced
failure_modes.fix: Re-square gantry per Voron docs. Check belt tension. Run Z tilt adjust (QGL for 2.4, Z_TILT for Trident).

failure_modes.cause: Chamber too hot, heater PID not tuned for chamber temps
failure_modes.fix: Re-tune PID with chamber at target temp. Ensure thermistor readings are accurate.

PLA.notes: Good PLA performance at high speeds.

quirks: Klipper firmware — access Mainsail/Fluidd interface via printer's IP address.
Input shaping pre-configured but may need re-tuning if you modify the printer.
PEI build plate works great but needs IPA cleaning between prints.

calibration.first_steps: Run auto-level from screen. Input shaping usually pre-configured — verify with test print.

PLA.notes: Open door for PLA to manage chamber temp.

PA-CF.notes: High-temp hotend (350C rated) handles PA-CF. Use hardened nozzle.

quirks: Custom Klipper firmware — some community macros may not work.
350C-rated hotend is one of the highest on the market — great for engineering materials.
Chamber heater available — reaches 60C+ for ABS/PC.

calibration.first_steps: Run QIDI's built-in calibration suite. Input shaping and pressure advance auto-tune available.

PLA.notes: Standard PLA settings. Works well on most Klipper setups.

PETG.notes: Reduce fan for better layer adhesion.

ABS.notes: Enclosure strongly recommended for ABS. Use draft shield in slicer if open-frame.

ASA.notes: Similar to ABS. Enclosure recommended for best results.

quirks: Use RESTART instead of M999 to restart firmware — Klipper does not support M999.
Pressure advance replaces linear advance — set via SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE ADVANCE=<value>.
Use SET_HEATER_TEMPERATURE for async heating — does not block like M109/M190.
Bed mesh calibration via BED_MESH_CALIBRATE macro — run after bed reaches target temperature.
Input shaper tuning recommended for high-speed printing — requires ADXL345 accelerometer for best results.

calibration.first_steps: Home all axes. Run BED_MESH_CALIBRATE. Set Z offset with PROBE_CALIBRATE. Save with SAVE_CONFIG.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print single-wall cube. Measure wall thickness. Adjust flow multiplier in slicer.
calibration.retraction_test: Direct drive: start at 0.4-0.8mm retraction. Tune with retraction tower.
calibration.pressure_advance: Print pressure advance tuning tower. Set via SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE ADVANCE=<value>. Save with SAVE_CONFIG.

failure_modes.cause: MCU cannot keep up with step rate — speed or acceleration too high for the board
failure_modes.fix: Lower max velocity/acceleration in printer.cfg. Upgrade to a faster MCU board if persistent.

failure_modes.symptom: ADC out of range error on startup
failure_modes.cause: Thermistor wiring issue or thermistor disconnected
failure_modes.fix: Check thermistor wiring connections. Verify thermistor type matches printer.cfg sensor_type setting.

failure_modes.symptom: Stepper motor buzzing but not moving
failure_modes.cause: Stepper driver current too low or wiring issue
failure_modes.fix: Check run_current in printer.cfg TMC section. Verify stepper wiring — swap two middle wires if motor vibrates in place.

failure_modes.cause: USB connection unstable or MCU overloaded
failure_modes.fix: Use a high-quality USB cable. Avoid USB hubs. Check dmesg for USB disconnect events. Consider UART/CAN connection.

failure_modes.cause: Probe wiring loose or probe triggered during travel
failure_modes.fix: Check probe wiring. Increase probe travel height (probe_hop). Ensure probe is not triggering from bed vibration.
